column4: I am attempting to replace my sudoers file on my harddrive install of edgy, right now I am in livecd and I have the install mounted into the live file system I cant get permission to edit the file though

I am attempting to replace my sudoers file on my harddrive install of edgy, right now I am in livecd and I have the install mounted into the live file system I cant get permission to edit the file though
anyone here know what Im talking about?
I have issued these command from the live environment so far; sudo mkdir /media/ubuntu ; sudo mount /dev/hdc1 /media/ubuntu
take a look at mine.. it's a little different than yours.
will your sudoers file mess up my old root password?
I hit ctrl x answered yes to save, it wanted to save file as sudoers.tmp i deleted the .temp it warned me that i was going to overwrite i answered yes that was the output
I don't think it's your visudo file. it looks fine.
